variant.bodyText: On behalf of everyone who was involved in SENSEVAL-2, we are happy to provide this volume of papers by the teams who participated in SENSEVAL-2, the second organized evaluation of word sense disambiguation systems. This volume constitutes the proceedings of the Second International Workshop on Evaluating Word Sense Disambiguation Systems that was held on July 5-6, 2001 in Toulouse (in conjunction with the 39th Annual Meeting of the ACL). Everyone who participated in SENSEVAL-2 by either submitting a system or organizing a task was invited to submit a 4-page paper to this proceedings. Every paper would be accepted, but each paper would be reviewed by at least two reviewers. If one submitted a paper, then they agreed to be a reviewer, thus the reviewing committee is the set of authors. Many people and organisations contributed to the success of SENSEVAL-2 and the workshop. Foremost, of course, are all the teams who submitted systems to be evaluated and the other teams (sometimes the same ones) who designed and organized tasks for those systems to compete in. These researchers form the core of the SENSEVAL community, and their papers are included within this proceedings. We thank the panel organisers and, of course, the many panelists, including Dan Flickinger (YY & CSLI), Anna Samiotou (ESTeam AB), Steve Finch (Infogistics), and Patrick Hanks (Lingomotors). Diana McCarthy and Michael Oakes coordinated and put together the page of system descriptions. Patrick Saint-Dizier and his crew provided the local arrangements, including a most memorable lunch. A special thanks goes to Randee Tengi for providing an advance-release of WordNet 1.7 specially for SENSEVAL. We'd also like to thank the many sponsors of this essentially volunteer effort. The workshop, an ACL-SIGLEX event, was supported by EURALEX, ELSNET, EPSRC (grant GR/R02337/01 - MATS), ELRA, and Pearson Education. Sharp Laboratories of Europe provided the main SENSEVAL-2 website, and the University of Pennsylvania the download site. The English tasks were sponsored by EPSRC (grant GR/R02337/01 — MATS), the National Science Foundation (NSF-9800658 — VerbNet, NSF- 9910603 — ISLE), DARPA (TIDES — PennTools), and the University of Pennsylvania. The Swedish organisers would like to thank The Swedish Council for Research in the Humanities and Social Sciences (HSI-4k) for providing financial support for the coordination of the task. The Estonian project (task) was sponsored in part by the Estonian Science Foundation (Grant No. 4467).

variant.abstract: Preface On behalf of everyone who was involved in SENSEVAL-2, we are happy to provide this volume of papers by the teams who participated in SENSEVAL-2, the second organized evaluation of word sense disambiguation systems. This volume constitutes the proceedings of the Second International Workshop on Evaluating Word Sense Disambiguation Systems that was held on July 5-6, 2001 in Toulouse (in with the Annual Meeting of the ACL). Everyone who participated in SENSEVAL-2 by either submitting a system or organizing a task was invited to submit a 4-page paper to this proceedings. Every paper would be accepted, but each paper would be reviewed by at least two reviewers. If one submitted a paper, then they agreed to be a reviewer, thus the reviewing committee is the set of authors. Many people and organisations contributed to the success of SENSEVAL-2 and the workshop. Foremost, of course, are all the teams who submitted systems to be evaluated and the other teams (sometimes the same ones) who designed and organized tasks for those systems to compete in. These researchers form the core of the SENSEVAL community, and their papers are included within this proceedings. We thank the panel organisers and, of course, the many panelists, including Dan Flickinger (YY &
variant.note: CSLI), Anna Samiotou (ESTeam AB), Steve Finch (Infogistics), and Patrick Hanks (Lingomotors). Diana McCarthy and Michael Oakes coordinated and put together the page of system descriptions. Patrick Saint-Dizier and his crew provided the local arrangements, including a most memorable lunch. A special thanks goes to Randee Tengi for providing an advance-release of WordNet 1.7 specially for SENSEVAL. We'd also like to thank the many sponsors of this essentially volunteer effort. The workshop, an ACL-SIGLEX event, was supported by EURALEX, ELSNET, EPSRC (grant GR/R02337/01 - MATS), ELRA, and Pearson Education. Sharp Laboratories of Europe provided the main SENSEVAL-2 website, and the University of Pennsylvania the download site. The English tasks were sponsored by EPSRC (grant GR/R02337/01 — MATS), the National Science Foundation (NSF-9800658 — VerbNet, NSF- 9910603 — ISLE), DARPA (TIDES — PennTools), and the University of Pennsylvania. The Swedish organisers would like to thank The Swedish Council for Research in the Humanities and Social Sciences (HSI-4k) for providing financial support for the coordination of the task. The Estonian project (task) was sponsored in part by the Estonian Science Foundation (Grant No. 4467). Scott Cotton, Phil Edmonds, Adam Kilgarriff, Martha Palmer SENSEVAL-2 Committee Judita Preiss, David Yarowsky Proceedings Editors
